Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Surgical Ventricular Reconstruction in Coronary Artery Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either CABG alone or CABG plus SVR.

Participants.evidence: patients with coronary artery disease and left ventricular dysfunction

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either CABG alone or CABG plus SVR.

Objective.evidence: The Surgical Treatment for Ischemic Heart Failure (STICH) trial aimed to determine if surgical ventricular reconstruction (SVR) plus coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) offers a mortality benefit over CABG alone.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was mortality or cardiac hospitalization over a 3-year follow-up.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was centrally managed, with allocation concealment.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial involved 1,000 patients.

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis was performed using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 3 years, no significant difference was observed in mortality or the combined outcome of death or cardiac hospitalization.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not disclosed.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not disclosed.
